intro: Tithymalus isauricus, commonly known as the Isaurian tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean, particularly in southern Europe and parts of Turkey. The plant is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescence composed of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tithymalus isauricus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings.
